body.p: Which directional description is not correct for the hypothalamus?

response.feedback: Correct. The parathyroid gland is in the neck region, inferior to the hypothalamus in the brain.
Incorrect. The hypothalamus is inferior to the thalamus.
Incorrect. The hypothalamus is superior to the pituitary gland. Read the question carefully.
Incorrect. The hypothalamus is in front of the pineal gland.

part.hint: All but one of these glands is associated with the brain.

body.p: Which of the following glands would not be cut with a mid-sagittal body section?

response.feedback: Correct. The sagittal plane divides the body vertically into the left and right sides. An adrenal gland exists on each side and would not be cut by mid-sagittal sectioning.
Incorrect. A portion of this gland is located in the midline of the body.
Incorrect. A portion of this gland is located in the midline of the body.
Incorrect. A portion of this gland would be cut with a midline split of the body.

part.hint: Paired, lateral organs would not be cut by a mid-sagittal body section because of their lateral position in the body.
